statement.p: Load factor refers to the amount of force imposed on an aircrafts body and contents (e.g., pilot). It is typically measured in g-forces. The maximum load factor is calculated by \displaystyle{n}={\left({\frac{{{V}}}{{{V}_{{s}}}}}\right)}^{{2}} where \displaystyle{V}_{{s}} is the stall speed and \displaystyle{V} is the current speed.

The stall speed (\displaystyle{V}_{{s}}) for a Cessna 206 is 54 kias. Maximum structural cruising speed (\displaystyle{V}_{{{N}{O}}}) is 147 kcas. Maneuvering speed (\displaystyle{V}_{{A}}) at this weight is about 122 kcas.
Calculate the V speed for a maximum load factor of 4. Give a numeric approximation rounded to the nearest unit.
